doc.repnme: When energy conservation doesn't work - critique of a DSM program
doc.abstracts: This Note is a contribution to an ongoing debate about the subsidies and rebates provided by power utilities to encourage consumers to adopt efficient end-use appliances. The argument presented here does not deny the need for demand-side energy conservation strategies (commonly known as demand side management or DSM) DSM programs can and do have a useful role in raising energy efficiency. This Note examines one particular "brand" of DSM which some in the energy industry believe is seriously flawed.
